overview.description: Manipur, located in northeastern India, is known for its lush landscapes, tribal culture, and Loktak Lake. Established as a state on January 21, 1972, it features attractions like Imphal and Loktak.

top_destinations.name: Imphal
top_destinations.description: The capital with Kangla Fort and Ima Market.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Visit Kangla Fort; explore local markets.

top_destinations.name: Loktak Lake
top_destinations.description: The largest freshwater lake with floating islands.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Take a boat ride; visit Sendra Island.

top_destinations.name: Ukhrul
top_destinations.description: A hill station known for its natural beauty and tribes.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Visit Shirui Kashung Peak; carry warm clothes.

culinary_delights.name: Café Coffee Day
culinary_delights.description: Cozy spot for coffee and snacks.

culinary_delights.name: Polo Kitchen
culinary_delights.description: Popular for Indian and Manipuri fusion.

culinary_delights.name: Hotel Sarita
culinary_delights.description: Offers a variety of North Indian specialties.

must_visit_spots.name: Kangla Fort
must_visit_spots.description: A historic site with cultural significance.

must_visit_spots.name: Loktak Lake and Sendra Island
must_visit_spots.tip: Take a boat ride at sunrise.

must_visit_spots.name: Shirui Kashung Peak
must_visit_spots.description: A scenic hill with rare Shirui lilies.

must_visit_spots.name: Keibul Lamjao National Park
must_visit_spots.description: Home to the endangered Sangai deer.

must_visit_spots.name: Moreh
must_visit_spots.description: A border town with Indo-Myanmar markets.

must_visit_spots.name: Thangjing Hill
must_visit_spots.description: A sacred hill with panoramic views.

travel_essentials.how_to_reach: By road: Imphal is 600 km from Guwahati (NH2, 12-14 hrs). By train: Nearest railhead Dimapur (215 km). By air: Imphal International Airport.
travel_essentials.tips: Carry warm clothing; check travel advisories.
